organizations: News Corp Australia Network Schuler Benson
title: Facebook glitch’s amazing love story
text:
Schuler Benson logged into Celeste Zendler’s Facebook account via a glitch and the pair are now married Ian Horswill News Corp Australia Network Schuler Benson logged into Celeste Zendler’s Facebook account via a glitch and the pair are now married Ian Horswill News Corp Australia Network Schuler and Celeste marry after the most unlikely way of meeting. Picture: Facebook 
THE odds are staggering but a Faceook user who logged onto a female stranger’s account due to a simple glitch has found love and the pair have married. 
Six years ago on October 4, Schuler Benson switched his mobile phone on to find it was logged in to a female stranger’s Facebook account. 
The woman, Celeste Zendler , had no mutual friends and Schuler, a writer, had never seen or even heard of her before. She lived in Colorado, which is over 1,600 kilometres away from his home in Arkansas. 
TEN SECRETS TO A LASTING, LOVING RELATIONSHIP Schuler Benson accidentally logged into a stranger's Facebook account and sparked a love affair that has turned into marriage. Picture: Facebook 
Schuler was stuck in Celeste’s account for a week and the pair began to communicate as ‘This is Celeste’ and ‘This is NOT Celeste’. Celeste sent Schuler a friend request to see if it would fix the glitch and it worked. Other Stories
